hints.content:
To find the amount of oil left, we subtract the number of $\text{mL}$ Matt used to make waffles $(\blueD{136 \text { mL}})$  from the total number of $\text{mL}$ he had to start $(\maroonD{650\text { mL}})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 650 milliliters. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total milliliters of oil. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 136 milliliters. The longer right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Waffle oil. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Oil left. !

hints.content: Matt has $\greenD{514}\text { mL}$ of cooking oil left.

question.content:
Matt bought a $650$ milliliter container of cooking oil. He used  $136$ milliliters of the oil making waffles.

**How much cooking oil does Matt have left?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] milliliters
